main event: A vaguely spherical object, estimated to be 60-70 feet in diameter, was sighted moving slowly towards the northeast over Tioga, North Dakota on August 3, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as white to yellowish-white in color, with no trail or exhaust.
The object's motion was irregular, as indicated by an astro computer.
An interceptor aircraft (F-89J) was dispatched to the area but the search concluded with negative results, as the observers indicated the object was still visible.
Similar reports from the same geographical location by reliable sources suggest unexplained phenomena, though nothing indicates a threat to US security or airspace.
The object was initially believed to be a natural astronomical phenomenon, such as a planet or star, or a balloon launch, but the investigation remains inconclusive.
sighted object: a vaguely spherical, white to yellowish-white object estimated to be 60-70 feet in diameter
